data.title: Screen Acting (B.F.A.) 4-year Plan
data.meta_description: Suggested 4-year plan for undergraduate students pursuing a B.F.A. in Screen Acting from Chapman University.
data.text:
This 4-year plan is for first-year students entering Chapman during the 2023-24 Academic Year.

If you entered Chapman in a previous academic year, you should work with your department or major advisor and use the Catalog for your year of entry to plan your course schedule.

Preparing for your Chapman Experience

Four-year Plans only include major-specific courses. In addition to those classes, you will take General Education courses and courses related to your chosen Exploration Focus (e.g., a minor, double major, Themed Inquiry or the Honors Program), which you will learn more about through the advising process. Just know: There are infinite possibilities.

Suggested 4-year Plan

We encourage you to select your General Education (GE) and minor/second major/Themed Inquiry/Honors program around the plan below. Once you fill your GE classes around your major classes, you will have a better idea of space remaining each semester when choosing your Exploration Focus.

To be enrolled full time, you must take at least 12 credits a semester.

In order to graduate within 4 years, we recommend you take 30 credits a year.

Year 1

Fall Semester (8.5 credits for major)

TH 105 - Theatre Practicum (0.5 credits)

TH 111 - Introduction to Performing Techniques (2 credits)

FTV 140 - Introduction to Film and Media Aesthetics, Lecture and Laboratory (3 credits)

TH 170 - Creating Theatre: From Page to Stage - The Art of Collaboration (3 credits)

Spring Semester (6.5 credits for major)

TH 105 - Theatre Practicum (0.5 credits)

TH 112 - Acting Fundamentals (3 credits)

FTV 130 - Introduction to Visual Storytelling (3 credits)

Year 2

Fall Semester (18 credits for major)

FP 115 - Editing I (3 credits)*

TH 218 - Character Building for Performance (3 credits)

SW 127 - Writing for Film and Television I (3 credits)

TH 230 - Screen Acting I (3 credits)

FP 239 - Directing I (3 credits)*

FS 244 - History of Film to 1959, Lecture and Laboratory (3 credits)

Spring Semester (3-6 credits for major)

FS 245 History of Film 1960 - Present, Lecture and Laboratory (3 credits)

TWP 320 - Narrative Television Workshop (3 credits) or TH 335 - Actors and Filmmakers Workshop (1-3 credits) [offered in summer]**

*Can take in fall or spring semesters.

**TH 335 in summer may be substituted for TWP 320.

Year 3

Fall Semester (12 credits for major)

FP 280 - Intermediate Production Workshop (3 credits)

TH 283 - Voice Production and Techniques I (3 credits)

TH 379 - Text Analysis and Scene Study for Performance (3 credits)

FTV/TH Elective (3 credits)***

Spring Semester (9 credits for major)

TH 211 - Movement for the Performer (3 credits)

TH 330 - Screen Acting II (3 credits)

FTV/TH Elective (3 credits)***

*** Students must complete 9 total credits of major electives. See the catalog for a list of elective classes. Electives can be taken in any semester.

Year 4

Fall Semester (12 credits for major)

TH 321 Meisner Technique (3 credits)

SCAC 497 Thesis in Screen Acting Workshop (3 credits)

TH 497A The Business of Acting (3 credits)

FTV/TH Elective (3 credits)***

Spring Semester (6 credits for major)

TH 476 The History of Acting in American Film from 1890 - 1970 (3 credits)

SCAC 498 Thesis in Screen Acting Workshop (3 credits)

*** Students must complete 9 total credits of major electives. See the catalog for a list of elective classes. Electives can be taken in any semester.
